content: Who won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1954, noted for his works such as "The Old Man and the Sea" and "A Farewell to Arms"?

The Nobel Prize in Literature in 1954 was awarded to Ernest Hemingway. He is indeed renowned for his works such as "The Old Man and the Sea" and "A Farewell to Arms." Hemingway's straightforward writing style and his focus on themes of masculinity, love, and death have made him one of the most influential writers of the 20th century.
